verses.kjv: Manasseh was twelve years old when he began to reign, and he reigned fifty and five years in Jerusalem:
verses.web: Manasseh was twelve years old when he began to reign, and he reigned fifty-five years in Jerusalem.
verses.ct: Manasseh was 12 years old when he became king, and he reigned 55 years in Jerusalem.

verses.kjv: But did that which was evil in the sight of the LORD, like unto the abominations of the heathen, whom the LORD had cast out before the children of Israel.
verses.web: He did that which was evil in LORD’s sight, after the abominations of the nations whom LORD cast out before the children of Israel.
verses.ct: The LORD saw that he was evil. He copied the disgusting practices of the nations the LORD had driven out to make room for the people of Israel.

verses.kjv: For he built again the high places which Hezekiah his father had broken down, and he reared up altars for Baalim, and made groves, and worshipped all the host of heaven, and served them.
verses.web: For he built again the high places which Hezekiah his father had broken down; and he raised up altars for the Baals, made Asheroth, and worshiped all the army of the sky, and served them.
verses.ct: He rebuilt the high places that his father Hezekiah had torn down, set up altars to the Baals, made Asherah poles, and bowed down to all the stars of heaven and worshiped them.

verses.kjv: Also he built altars in the house of the LORD, whereof the LORD had said, In Jerusalem shall my name be for ever.
verses.web: He built altars in LORD’s house, of which LORD said, “My name shall be in Jerusalem forever.”
verses.ct: He even built pagan altars inside the LORD's temple — the very place where the LORD had said, "My name will be in Jerusalem forever."

verses.kjv: And he built altars for all the host of heaven in the two courts of the house of the LORD.
verses.web: He built altars for all the army of the sky in the two courts of LORD’s house.
verses.ct: He built altars to all the stars of heaven in both courtyards of the LORD's temple.

verses.kjv: And he caused his children to pass through the fire in the valley of the son of Hinnom: also he observed times, and used enchantments, and used witchcraft, and dealt with a familiar spirit, and with wizards: he wrought much evil in the sight of the LORD, to provoke him to anger.
verses.web: He also made his children to pass through the fire in the valley of the son of Hinnom. He practiced sorcery, divination, and witchcraft, and dealt with those who had familiar spirits and with wizards. He did much evil in LORD’s sight, to provoke him to anger.
verses.ct: He sacrificed his own children in the fire in the Valley of Ben Hinnom. He practiced sorcery, divination, and witchcraft, and consulted mediums and spiritists. The LORD saw how deeply evil he was, and it provoked God to anger.

verses.kjv: And he set a carved image, the idol which he had made, in the house of God, of which God had said to David and to Solomon his son, In this house, and in Jerusalem, which I have chosen before all the tribes of Israel, will I put my name for ever:
verses.web: He set the engraved image of the idol, which he had made, in God’s house, of which God said to David and to Solomon his son, “In this house, and in Jerusalem, which I have chosen out of all the tribes of Israel, I will put my name forever.
verses.ct: He placed a carved idol he had made right inside God's temple. This was the place where God had told David and his son Solomon, "Out of all the tribes of Israel, I have chosen this temple and this city of Jerusalem. I will put my name here forever."

verses.kjv: Neither will I any more remove the foot of Israel from out of the land which I have appointed for your fathers; so that they will take heed to do all that I have commanded them, according to the whole law and the statutes and the ordinances by the hand of Moses.
verses.web: I will not any more remove the foot of Israel from off the land which I have appointed for your fathers, if only they will observe to do all that I have commanded them, even all the law, the statutes, and the ordinances given by Moses.”
verses.ct: "I will never again drive Israel from the land I gave to your ancestors — as long as they are careful to obey everything I commanded them through Moses: the entire law, the statutes, and the ordinances."

verses.kjv: So Manasseh made Judah and the inhabitants of Jerusalem to err, and to do worse than the heathen, whom the LORD had destroyed before the children of Israel.
verses.web: Manasseh seduced Judah and the inhabitants of Jerusalem, so that they did more evil than did the nations whom LORD destroyed before the children of Israel.
verses.ct: But Manasseh led Judah and the people of Jerusalem so far astray that they became even worse than the nations the LORD had destroyed to make room for Israel.

verses.kjv: And the LORD spake to Manasseh, and to his people: but they would not hearken.
verses.web: LORD spoke to Manasseh, and to his people; but they didn’t listen.
verses.ct: The LORD warned Manasseh and his people, but they refused to listen.

verses.kjv: Wherefore the LORD brought upon them the captains of the host of the king of Assyria, which took Manasseh among the thorns, and bound him with fetters, and carried him to Babylon.
verses.web: Therefore LORD brought on them the captains of the army of the king of Assyria, who took Manasseh in chains, bound him with fetters, and carried him to Babylon.
verses.ct: So the LORD sent the commanders of the Assyrian army against them. They captured Manasseh, put a hook in his nose, bound him with bronze chains, and hauled him off to Babylon.

verses.kjv: And when he was in affliction, he besought the LORD his God, and humbled himself greatly before the God of his fathers,
verses.web: When he was in distress, he begged LORD his God, and humbled himself greatly before the God of his fathers.
verses.ct: In his misery, Manasseh begged the LORD his God for help and deeply humbled himself before the God of his ancestors.

verses.kjv: And prayed unto him: and he was intreated of him, and heard his supplication, and brought him again to Jerusalem into his kingdom. Then Manasseh knew that the LORD he was God.
verses.web: He prayed to him; and he was entreated by him, and heard his supplication, and brought him again to Jerusalem into his kingdom. Then Manasseh knew that LORD was God.
verses.ct: He prayed, and God was moved by his plea. God heard his prayer and brought him back to Jerusalem and restored his kingdom. That's when Manasseh finally understood that the LORD truly is God.

verses.kjv: Now after this he built a wall without the city of David, on the west side of Gihon, in the valley, even to the entering in at the fish gate, and compassed about Ophel, and raised it up a very great height, and put captains of war in all the fenced cities of Judah.
verses.web: Now after this, he built an outer wall to David’s city, on the west side of Gihon, in the valley, even to the entrance at the fish gate. He encircled Ophel with it, and raised it up to a very great height; and he put valiant captains in all the fortified cities of Judah.
verses.ct: After that, he built a high outer wall on the west side of the City of David, running from the Gihon spring through the valley all the way to the Fish Gate, encircling the hill of Ophel. He raised it to a tremendous height and stationed military commanders in every fortified city throughout Judah.

verses.kjv: And he took away the strange gods, and the idol out of the house of the LORD, and all the altars that he had built in the mount of the house of the LORD, and in Jerusalem, and cast them out of the city.
verses.web: He took away the foreign gods, and the idol out of LORD’s house, and all the altars that he had built in the mountain of LORD’s house, and in Jerusalem, and cast them out of the city.
verses.ct: He removed the foreign gods and the idol from the LORD's temple, along with every altar he had built on the temple mount and throughout Jerusalem, and threw them all outside the city.

verses.kjv: And he repaired the altar of the LORD, and sacrificed thereon peace offerings and thank offerings, and commanded Judah to serve the LORD God of Israel.
verses.web: He built up LORD’s altar, and offered sacrifices of peace offerings and of thanksgiving on it, and commanded Judah to serve LORD, the God of Israel.
verses.ct: Then he restored the LORD's altar and offered peace offerings and thank offerings on it. He ordered all of Judah to serve the LORD, the God of Israel.

verses.kjv: Nevertheless the people did sacrifice still in the high places, yet unto the LORD their God only.
verses.web: Nevertheless the people sacrificed still in the high places, but only to LORD their God.
verses.ct: The people still offered sacrifices at the high places, though they offered them only to the LORD their God.

verses.kjv: Now the rest of the acts of Manasseh, and his prayer unto his God, and the words of the seers that spake to him in the name of the LORD God of Israel, behold, they are written in the book of the kings of Israel.
verses.web: Now the rest of the acts of Manasseh, and his prayer to his God, and the words of the seers who spoke to him in the name of LORD, the God of Israel, behold, they are written among the acts of the kings of Israel.
verses.ct: Everything else about Manasseh's reign — including his prayer to God and the messages the prophets delivered to him in the name of the LORD, the God of Israel — is recorded in the official history of Israel's kings.

verses.kjv: His prayer also, and how God was intreated of him, and all his sins, and his trespass, and the places wherein he built high places, and set up groves and graven images, before he was humbled: behold, they are written among the sayings of the seers.
verses.web: His prayer also, and how God was entreated of him, and all his sin and his trespass, and the places in which he built high places, and set up the Asherah poles and the engraved images, before he humbled himself: behold, they are written in the history of Hozai.
verses.ct: His prayer, how God responded to it, all his sin and unfaithfulness, and the locations where he built high places and set up Asherah poles and carved images before he humbled himself — all of this is recorded in the writings of the seers.

verses.kjv: So Manasseh slept with his fathers, and they buried him in his own house: and Amon his son reigned in his stead.
verses.web: So Manasseh slept with his fathers, and they buried him in his own house; and Amon his son reigned in his place.
verses.ct: Manasseh died and was buried in his own palace. His son Amon became king after him.

verses.kjv: Amon was two and twenty years old when he began to reign, and reigned two years in Jerusalem.
verses.web: Amon was twenty-two years old when he began to reign; and he reigned two years in Jerusalem.
verses.ct: Amon was 22 years old when he became king, and he reigned 2 years in Jerusalem.

verses.kjv: But he did that which was evil in the sight of the LORD, as did Manasseh his father: for Amon sacrificed unto all the carved images which Manasseh his father had made, and served them;
verses.web: He did that which was evil in LORD’s sight, as did Manasseh his father; and Amon sacrificed to all the engraved images which Manasseh his father had made, and served them.
verses.ct: The LORD saw that he was evil, just like his father Manasseh. Amon offered sacrifices to every carved idol his father Manasseh had made and worshiped them.

verses.kjv: And humbled not himself before the LORD, as Manasseh his father had humbled himself; but Amon trespassed more and more.
verses.web: He didn’t humble himself before LORD, as Manasseh his father had humbled himself; but this same Amon trespassed more and more.
verses.ct: But unlike his father Manasseh, Amon never humbled himself before the LORD. Instead, he piled up more and more guilt.

verses.kjv: And his servants conspired against him, and slew him in his own house.
verses.web: His servants conspired against him, and put him to death in his own house.
verses.ct: His own officials conspired against him and assassinated him in his palace.

verses.kjv: But the people of the land slew all them that had conspired against king Amon; and the people of the land made Josiah his son king in his stead.
verses.web: But the people of the land killed all those who had conspired against king Amon; and the people of the land made Josiah his son king in his place.
verses.ct: But the common people of the land killed everyone who had plotted against King Amon, and they made his son Josiah the next king.
